div.head: Boundary Dispute between Nedinum and an Unknown Party

p.seg:
This fragmentary inscription attests to a boundary dispute between Nedinum (mod. Nedim in Croatia) and another community whose name is lost. The dispute was settled by a centurion who had been appointed as iudex by the provincial governor. The placement of the phrase ex convent/[ione eo]r(um) would seem to indicate that the Neditae and their opponents had agreed upon the appointment of the iudex. Compare Instance
9 (Elliott 2004) .

div.p:
This marker was discovered, not in situ, in the modern community of Karin (ancient Corinium) and so may constitute another chapter in the repeated boundary difficulties between these two communities that are attested by the epigraphy. Instance
3 (Elliott 2004) .
